description: Expected results for JavaScript AST query validation

n1-generic-vars.js.title: Generic Variable Names
n1-generic-vars.js.description: Tests variable_declarator with forbidden generic names

n2-redundant-returns.js.title: Redundant Conditional Returns
n2-redundant-returns.js.description: Tests if_statement with return true/false patterns

n3-ternary-booleans.js.title: Ternary Returning Boolean Literals
n3-ternary-booleans.js.description: Tests ternary_expression with true/false as consequence and alternative

n4-boolean-comparisons.js.title: Redundant Boolean Comparisons
n4-boolean-comparisons.js.description: Tests binary_expression comparing to true/false literals

n6-generic-functions.js.title: Generic Function Names
n6-generic-functions.js.description: Tests function_declaration with handleData, processItem, etc.

n7-single-letter-vars.js.title: Single-Letter Variables
n7-single-letter-vars.js.description: Tests variable_declarator with single-letter names (except i,j,k,m)

comments.js.description: All rule violation patterns are inside comments (single-line and multi-line). AST queries should not match comment content.

strings.js.description: All rule violation patterns are inside string literals (single, double, template). AST queries should not match string content.

similar-patterns.js.description: Valid code that looks similar to violations but uses allowed patterns (descriptive names, strict equality, const/let, etc.).

notes.n1: The regex ^(data|result|temp|info|item|value|obj|thing|stuff|tmp|ret|val)$ must match exactly these names
notes.n2: Complex pattern requiring if with return true in consequence and return false in alternative (or vice versa)
notes.n3: Matches ternary with both consequence and alternative being true or false
notes.n4: Only matches === or !== with true/false on the RIGHT side
notes.n5: Requires 3+ numbers in a multiplication chain (60 * 60 * 1000)
notes.n7: Regex ^[a-hln-z]$ excludes i, j, k, m as allowed loop counters
notes.n8: Only matches console.log, not other console methods
notes.s1: Matches await inside for_statement, for_in_statement, or while_statement body
